1254863160613367808.text: I look forward to working with the Dept. of Education, @BetsyDeVosED, and congressional leadership to help families and move our country forward. 9/9

1254863159069831168.text: I think it’s important to continue to look for ways to make smart targeted changes to federal regulations that can positively impact families. See my full statement, here: 8/9 https://t.co/qN2x3U3UKR

1254863157660696576.text: This is a simple change that doesn’t cost the federal govt and taxpayers $ but can have a large impact on student learning and easing the economic burden families facing this unprecedented challenge. 7/9

1254863156725219328.text: Currently, if 529 account withdrawals are not used for qualified education expenses or tuition for elementary or secondary schools, they are subject to state and federal income taxes and an additional 10% federal tax penalty on earnings of the account. 6/9

1254863155546566659.text: 529 plans were recently expanded to cover high school & elementary school tuition. Especially during this unique time, it is important to allow families to use money that has been set aside for their kid’s education, without being taxed & penalized by the federal government. 5/9

1254863154569502720.text: What are 529 plans? A 529 plan is a tax-advantaged savings plan designed to encourage saving for future education costs. It is like a retirement account for qualified education expenses. Typically, these plans have been used for higher education costs, like college tuition. 4/9

1254863153588047878.text: Parents & schools are facing unique challenges while trying to educate our children from home. These can range from lack of economic resources to lack of tools necessary for distance education. Congress should change 529 plans to help students & families ease the burden. 3/9

1254863152514125824.text: #coronavirus has impacted millions of school children. Families are educating their children from home because schools are closed. 2/9

1254863150098157568.text: Congress should act to allow 529 education savings plans to cover expenses related to learning from home. See my full letter to Congressional leadership. 1/9 https://t.co/q7McoDf7Ab

1136739321418043395.text:
Sadly, many of those men, did not return home. 
 
More than 400,000 U.S. soldiers died during World War II. 

More than 7,000 of those soldiers were from Wisconsin.
 
We remember their great sacrifice.

1136739157768847363.text:
Because of what was in their hearts – patriotism, love, honor – it allowed them to overcome the great emotions that must have been going through their minds.
 
Our troops climbed those cliffs, and, in the end, they freed Europe.

1136738954416463879.text: These brave men endeavored on this pursuit because of their love for America, their love for their family, their love for their fellow countrymen, and for their love of the ideals that Americans believe in.

1136738586068492296.text: 75 years ago, young men approached the beachhead, while taking fire from the large sea cliffs above. Bullets were flying past their heads, friends were dying beside them. https://t.co/PVlxOIVgo8

1136690708713287680.text:
Before the D-Day invasion, Commander of the Allied Troops in Europe, Dwight D. Eisenhower told the troops, “The eyes of the world are upon you. The hope and prayers of liberty-loving people everywhere march with you.”
 
This quote is enshrined on the WWII Memorial in D.C. https://t.co/yJLhqUocRT

1136400253094170624.text:

1136004070731407360.text: After liberating Rome, the Allied troops went on to liberate the rest of Europe. My grandpa was among the troops who liberated Dachau. Dachau was a concentration camp where the Nazis murdered thousands of Jews and other political prisoners.

1136002611340070912.text: When the Allied troops liberated Rome on June 4, 1944, they stayed in various places throughout the city. My grandpa kept his key from where he rested in Rome. https://t.co/1QcwjE0wdZ

1135985971084824577.text: The cover of Stars and Stripes on June 6th, 1944 featured the Liberation of Rome that took place two days earlier. The Liberation of Rome, while it was a significant victory as the troops had captured an Axis capital city, would be overshadowed by a major event on June 6, D-Day. https://t.co/iBSo4Nt8Ho

1135955542919327745.text: Today marks the 75th Anniversary of the Liberation of Rome from the Nazi occupation on June 4, 1944. My grandpa (front row – third from left) and fellow Allied troops took this picture outside of Rome 75 years ago. https://t.co/SGG3Xe6EQT
